screen.title: Technical Verification
screen.subtitle: Complete these missions to activate your sale. Verified products sell 3x faster.

missions.physicalDesc: Prove you have the product in hand.
missions.physicalInstruction: Take a photo of the actual product next to a piece of paper with your username and today's date.
missions.performanceDesc: Prove the graph performs under stress.
missions.performanceInstruction: Upload a photo of your monitor showing the 3DMark Time Spy result next to your signature paper.

benchmark.step1Desc:
Search for '3DMark' in the Steam store.

Do NOT buy it, it's free.
benchmark.step2Desc:
Look for the 'Download Demo' button.

Remember, you don't need to buy the application.
benchmark.step3Desc:
In the top right bar of the app, look for a button called 'Benchmark'.

Click it and it will take you to the Benchmark section.
benchmark.step4Desc:
Scroll down a bit and look for the benchmark called 'Time Spy'.

Click on it.
benchmark.step5Desc: When you are on the screen to run the test, it is recommended to close all applications to obtain a better result.
benchmark.step6Desc:
Once the test is finished, take a photo with your cell phone of the monitor showing:

• The '3DMark' result.
• The taskbar showing the date.

The 3DMark app should not be in full screen. Try to replicate the example image so that everything is clear.

Otherwise, your verification may be rejected.
benchmark.step7Desc:
Write down or save the score of your component that appears in '3DMark' (either CPU or GPU).

You will be asked that you write it in the 'Graphic Score' box when you upload your verification photo.

info.title: Guide: Verifying Specs
info.step1Desc:
Download CPU-Z (It's safe). The official website is cpuid.com.

Install the application. It's small and quick to install.
info.step2Desc:
Open CPU-Z. It will ask for administrator privileges; accept them.

Once the application is open, look for the 'SPD' tab. Leave the CPU-Z window open in that section.
info.step3Desc:
Open Task Manager in Windows by pressing 'Ctrl + Shift + Esc'.

Once open, go to the 'Performance' section, then 'Memory'.

Leave this window open along with CPU-Z.
info.step4Desc:
With both windows open (CPU-Z and Task Manager), take a photo with your phone where both windows are clearly visible.

Make sure all the information is legible to avoid your verification being rejected.

mobo.step1Desc:
Download CPU-Z (It's safe). The official website is cpuid.com.

Download and install the application. It's small and quick to install.
mobo.step2Desc:
Open CPU-Z. It will ask for administrator privileges; accept them.

Once the application is open, find the 'Mainboard' tab. Leave the CPU-Z window open in that section.
mobo.step3Desc:
Take a clear photo of the monitor showing the 'CPU-Z' information in the 'Mainboard' section.

Make sure all the information is legible to avoid your verification being rejected.
